title: Château Pape Clément 2015  Pessac-Léognan
description: Rich, already attractive, this wine sums up the whites in this vintage. With its opulent character and great fruit, it is rich, tangy and lightly herbal. It is a very complete wine and will be delicious from 2023.

title: Le Dôme 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. A generously perfumed wine, this has great tannins, spice and intense black fruits on the palate. It's powerful, rich and smoky, fueled as much by its fruit as its tannins. A fine wine for aging; try after 2024.

title: Château Brane-Cantenac 2017 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. While the wood flavors are palpable in this wine, so are the firm tannins and dense black fruit. These elements suggest a wine that will have power and great concentration while also generous blackberry fruits. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Giscours 2017 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This is dense and concentrated, packed with firm tannins as well as powerful fruit. The solid structure is balanced by rich blackberry and plum flavors, resulting in a wine that has a fine future ahead of it. Drink from 2024.

title: Château la Gaffelière 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This is a powerful wine, with great power and richness from concentrated fruit and dense tannins. The ripe black fruits are impressive, solid and intense. It will age well for many years; try after 2023.

title: Château Pavie Macquin 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Big in tannins as well as fruit, this wine is very fine. It has weight, concentrated black fruits and juicy acidity. The fruit is approachable, giving fruitiness and a soft aftertaste. Drink this fine wine from 2024.

title: Château Pichon Longueville 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This wine has power and plenty of concentration. Rich fruit bursts out of the glass already, suggesting a wine that will age relatively quickly for this estate. It does have concentration as well as bold fruits that will let the wine mature from 2025.

title: Berlucchi 2010 '61 Nature  (Franciacorta)
description: Balanced and fragrant, this impressive sparkler offers alluring scents of yellow stone fruit and an inviting whiff of brioche. A blend of 80% Chardonnay and 20% Pinot Nero, it's elegantly structured and focused, delivering flavors of yellow apple, white peach, bread crust and crushed stone framed in bright acidity and elegant perlage. A vanilla note lingers on the bone-dry finish. It's extremely well balanced and refined.

title: Château de Fieuzal 2015  Pessac-Léognan
description: Ripe and spicy, this is a smoothly textured wine. Its wood aging and creamy texture are rich, opulent and generous. With tangy acidity in the background, this dense wine is already impressive. Drink from 2022.

title: Halcón 2015 Tierra Petite Sirah (Yorkville Highlands)
description: This excellent wine from a steep terraced vineyard offers beautiful aromas of lavender and violet that segue to a palate replete with black fruit, black pepper and anise tones. Each flavor seems especially well defined and they layer together harmoniously on a velvety texture that provides good support for all that concentration. Best after 2020.

title: Niepoort 2013 Robustus Red (Douro)
description: The name of this release goes back to the first red wine made by Niepoort in 1990. The wine was made with long old-barrel aging and was not bottled until 2017. Tannins are important to this rich wine; so is the powerful black fruit. They offer an mineral- and fruit-driven wine that still needs to age. Drink from 2020.

title: Quinta do Vesuvio 2015 Red (Douro)
description: Made by the Symington family, a major producer in the Douro, this wine comes from one of the region's legendary estates. With 16 months in wood, the wine has been smoothed and its fruit polished to give an opulent wine with plenty of tannic structure. Rich blackberry flavors have a strongly mineral texture that will allow this wine to age well. Drink from 2022.

title: Ca' del Bosco 2013 Vintage Collection Dosage Zero  (Franciacorta)
description: This stunning sparkler is all about precision, finesse and purity. It opens with enticing scents of white spring flower, crushed stone, lemon pastry and hazelnut. The aromas carry over to the chiseled palate together with creamy yellow apple, tangerine zest, brioche and mineral notes alongside an elegant perlage. Vibrant acidity gives it balance and structure.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Calegari Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine offers a compelling nose of pretty florals and spicy forest-floor aromas. Dense on entry, it lingers in flavors of orange, cherry and rhubarb, with textured tannins and an undercurrent of a stony, mineral character.

title: Ca' del Bosco 2008 Vintage Collection Dosaggio Zéro Noir  (Franciacorta)
description: Alluring aromas of bread crust, nectarine zest, berry and orchard fruit take center stage on this compelling sparkler. Made entirely with Pinot Nero, it's all about elegance, offering wild cherry, brioche, citrus and mineral alongside fresh acidity and tangy acidity. An ultrarefined perlage carries through to the dry succulent finish.

title: Château la Fleur-Pétrus 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This fine wine from the central plateau of Pomerol has a beautifully structured character, rich in layers of tannins and black fruits. Juicy and full in weight, it has power and density and great aging potential.

title: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This indulgent wine is rich, opulent and concentrated. At the same time, the core of botrytis and rich fruit will allow the wine to age well. The finish boasts an acidic lift and a touch of ginger flavor. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Guiraud 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Ripe, botrytized fruit currently dominates this wine with its rich concentration. It is a full and liquorous wine that will age for many years. Drink from 2025.

title: Château Palmer 2017 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Ripe black fruits are held aloft by a core of firm tannins. The juicy black-currant flavors are full, rich, generous and structured. This wine is already beautifully balanced, harmonious and with a fine, medium-term future, nothing in excess. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. An impressively concentrated wine this is full of rich tannins and dark black plum notes. Its structure and smoky character meld with rich black fruits and spice flavors; this is a wine for aging. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Rich and warm, this generous wine balances a strongly mineral texture and acidity with ripe quince, apple and pear flavors. It is a wine for aging, likely to be ready to drink from 2023.

title: Château Rauzan-Ségla 2017 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This wine has a densely tannic structure and ripe berry fruits that are just beginning to shine. Acidity, spice and richness suggest this has good aging potential. It should be held until 2024.

title: Château Latour-Martillac 2015  Pessac-Léognan
description: Solid tannins mark this still very young wine. At the same time, the fruit is rich and well proportioned. Black currants dominate the fruity spectrum, giving the wine richness as well as great potential. Drink from 2025.

title: Château l'Évangile 2015  Pomerol
description: Densely tannic, this wine displays considerable power and concentration. With 84% Merlot it exhibits jammy, rich black-plum and blackberry fruit and powerful tannins. This is an enormous wine, still very firm. Drink from 2026.

title: Domaine de Chevalier 2015  Pessac-Léognan
description: This wine is ripe, rich and generous. It brings out the almost-sweet character of the fruit in this vintage. At the same time, the tannins are firm and support all this fruitiness. The wine will develop well. Drink from 2024.

title: Château La Conseillante 2015  Pomerol
description: This is a perfumed wine, rich in tannins and with a good balance between the Merlot and Cabernet Franc in the blend. Ripe black fruits and velvet tannins give the wine elegance and charm. It is juicy and ripe, with a background of firm structure set against a crisp final texture. The wine will develop well; drink from 2025.

title: Campo alle Comete 2015  Bolgheri Superiore
description: Enticing scents of scorched earth, cassis, new leather, vanilla, truffle and Mediterranean brush abound on this classy red. The full-bodied youthfully austere palate is still tightly wound but already shows mature black cherry, raspberry preserve, licorice and grilled herb set against a backbone of firm fine-grained tannins. Give it time to fully develop. Drink 2022–2030.

title: JCP Maltus 2015 Vieux Château Mazerat  (Saint-Émilion)
description: This powerful wine has great structure, fine and elegant tannins, and ripe black fruits. It wears its heart on its sleeve. The concentration doesn't take away from the juicy fruit and wealth of complex flavors. A wine with a great future, it won't be ready to drink before 2026.

title: Mvemve Raats 2015 MR de Compostella Red (Stellenbosch)
description: Perhaps the best vintage of Compostella to date, the 2015 vintage is a blend of 40% Cabernet Franc, 32% Cabernet Sauvignon, 13% Merlot, 11% Petit Verdot and 4% Malbec. It showcases a beautiful elegance and herbal edge in waves of cigar tobacco and blackcurrant leaf, with a grounded fruit core of blackberry, plum and cassis. Additional notes of leather and German chocolate cake lend depth and intrigue, while the finish exhibits a masterful evolution between all these components with each sip. Well-structured and superbly balanced, it boasts gripping tannins and ample acidity to frame the ripe fruit. A beauty that should mature masterfully, drink 2023–2033.

title: Château Clerc Milon 2015  Pauillac
description: Densely structured and firm, this wine has weight, rich black fruits and great concentration. The tannins are still considerable, with obvious potential. This estate is now on top form. Drink this impressive wine from 2026.
